Description: Part of a corroded copper alloy buckle (?), made of a flat rectangular plaque with a round hole perforated in the center, and a semi-circular hoop, a bit larger than the plaque, welded on its corners on one side. On the opposite side, the edge is almost completely and irregularly bevelled.
Curator's comments: The Museum register indicates a general reference to the small bronze finds mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 80 § 80, where the item is not clearly described. See also other possible buckles or part of buckles : London, BM, EA 23869, 23870, 23871, 23886. Two copper alloy buckles also from Tell Dafana, of Roman or Byzantine type, are in Cairo, EM, JE 27370 a & b.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 80 § 80) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.79, p.185, pl.27)
